children.text:
We are given two Python programs to be executed in sequence. First program (File1):
  Reads three integers n, a, b (though a and b are the sizes of two lists, but we read them and then ignore them for the list reading?). Then reads a list of a integers and a list of b integers. Then for k from 0 to n-1, it checks if (k+1) is in the first list (lista). If yes, prints "1 ", else "2 ".

children.text: However, note that the second program (File2) expects input from stdin. But in the chain, the output of the first program becomes the input of the second. But wait: the first program prints a string of numbers (each 1 or 2) with spaces.
children.label: mental_execution

      int main() {
          int n, a, b;
          scanf("%d %d %d", &n, &a, &b);

          // Read the a integers from the next line
          for (int i = 0; i < a; i++) {
              int x;
              scanf("%d", &x);
          }

          // Read the b integers from the next line
          for (int i = 0; i < b; i++) {
              int x;
              scanf("%d", &x);
          }

          if (n > 0) {
              printf("NO\n");
          }

          return 0;
      }

      int main() {
          int n, a, b;
